a.title: Click here for more School News

div.div: April 16, 2020 Hello Fort Lee Families, I hope that you are all enjoying your spring break. The last thing that I want to do is interrupt this time for you. However, some important information came out today that I need to share with you. This afternoon, Governor Murphy announced that schools will remain closed through at least Friday, May 15. This will continue to help to flatten the curve and slow the transmission of coronavirus. This decision was made in consultation with the New Jersey Department of Health and the Department of Education. I understand that this is a challenging situation for everyone in our community. I know I speak for all of the Fort Lee Public Schools staff when I say that this is equally as difficult for us. Your teachers, Principals, para-professionals and everyone else, all miss having our classrooms, hallways, and playgrounds filled with students who are learning and growing every day. We will continue to do the best we can to provide the online instruction experience during this unprecedented time. We all realize that it is nothing close to the experiences that occur in a school on a daily basis. As more information becomes available, I will notify you. Maintain your practice of social distancing. It is still working, but we are not there yet. Enjoy the remainder of your break. Stay home and stay safe. We will get through this, TOGETHER. Sincerely, Kenneth Rota Superintendent of Schools
div.a: Read More about 04-16-20 - COVID-19
BOE Meeting Notice for 4/20/20
div.div: MEETING CHANGE ZOOM PUBLIC BOARD OF EDUCATION MEETING AND REFUNDING BOND ORDINANCE PUBLIC HEARING PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that the Public Business Meeting of the Fort Lee Board of Education on April 20, 2020 will be held at 7:30 p.m. During this Public Business Meeting, there will be a Public Hearing on the proposed Adoption of the Refunding Bond Ordinance. The Executive/Private Meeting of the Fort Lee Board of Education to discuss personnel, legal, and other confidential matters will be held at 6:45 p.m. directly preceding the Public Business Meeting. Due to the Governor’s Executive Order 104 citing the CDC’s recommendation for cancellation or postponement of gatherings of fifty or more people for eight weeks, the Public Business Meeting will be held utilizing videoconferencing. Please join the Zoom Public Business Meeting at from your computer or mobile device.
div.a: Read More about BOE Meeting Notice for 4/20/20
2018-2019 School Performance Reports
div.div: The 2018-2019 School Performance Reports have been posted on our Fort Lee Public Schools / Board of Ed / District Testing Reports webpage.
div.a: Read More about 2018-2019 School Performance Reports

a.title: Extended Plan for Continued Food Service

div.a: Extended Plan for Continued Food Service
div.div: The District will begin distributing meals at no charge to eligible students at both Fort Lee High School and, beginning this coming Monday (4/13), at Lewis F. Cole Middle School. The District is committed to continued meal service during Spring Break to ensure families who would like lunch meals can, in fact, have them. Pomptonian will prepare lunch meals that contain an entree, two servings of fruit and vegetables and a cold milk in a Grab-and-Go style. Meals will continue to be available for pick-up at Fort Lee High School from 10am to 1pm. Meals will be available for pick-up at Lewis F. Cole Middle School beginning Monday, 4/13, from 11am to 1pm. As a reminder, Friday, April 10th, is a school holiday. No meals will be distributed from either location on Friday, however, two meals can be picked up on Thursday (one for Thursday, April 9th and one for Friday, April 10th). Be well and stay safe.
div.a: Read More about Extended Plan for Continued Food Service
First Responder Window Appreciation Project
div.div: Please help us spread the news on this project! Attention all residents of Fort Lee! We're rolling out a campaign today urging everyone - children and adults alike - to create signs for their windows thanking the Essential Workers/First Responders for all to see. We want to show our appreciation to everyone who is out there every day risking THEIR lives to help OURS - police officers, fire fighters, EMTs, doctors & nurses, cleaning staffs, store workers, pharmacists, restaurant workers, delivery people, etc. Hang your signs where everyone can see them - in the window, on the garage door, on the porch - and let us know that you are grateful for the heroes who are working tirelessly throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. Post your works of art on social media with the hashtags #BeFortLee,#FortLeeStrong,#WereInThisTogether and#FortLeeCares, and message your photos to us on Facebook at @FortLeeToday so we can proudly post them. Thank you in advance for your participation!
div.a: Read More about First Responder Window Appreciation Project

a.title: Fort Lee school families in need

div.a: Fort Lee school families in need
div.div: First and foremost, we hope you and your families are safe. The four elementary PTAs have come together to raise money for some of our Fort Lee school families in need during these times. We became aware of some families that were being offered meals however these meals are only available during what would be normal school days (Monday - Friday). We are trying to raise money to purchase gift cards for groceries in order to help cover the weekends. We realize these are difficult times for all. Donations are optional and all amounts make a difference. Donations can be made via gofundme
div.a: Read More about Fort Lee school families in need

a.title: Free Kids Lunch at El Malecon Restaurant

div.a: Free Kids Lunch at El Malecon Restaurant
div.div: El Malecon Restaurant located at 1400 Anderson Avenue is offering free kids lunch to all students with valid school ID or genesis account. This is happening Monday through Friday, 11:30-2pm. If you have any questions, please contact the EL Malecon Restaurant directly. The school district does not have any additional information.
div.a: Read More about Free Kids Lunch at El Malecon Restaurant

a.title: A Message From the School Counseling Office

div.a: A Message From the School Counseling Office
div.div: On behalf of the School Counseling Department, I would like to share a variety of resources that address ways to communicate with your children in regards to COVID-19.
div.a: Read More about A Message From the School Counseling Office
Jersey Mike's Subs
div.div: Jersey Mike's Subs want to help our students during this time out of school. Jersey's Mike's locations in Fort Lee, Paramus, and Rochelle Park are offering free kids meals Monday through Friday from 11am to 2pm to students who rely on school lunches. All students have to do is go to one of the locations during those times, present a Fort Lee Public School student ID, and ask for the child's meal and they will receive a free lunch for that day. Please be sure to thank Jersey Mike's for offering to assist the community during this time of school closure. Be safe and stay healthy.
div.a: Read More about Jersey Mike's Subs

Subscription (fee-based) Busing
div.div: Subscription (Parent-Paid) Busing for 5th and 6th graders who live LESS than 2 miles from the new Intermediate School only will begin on Monday, September 9, 2019. Parent letters/mailings with student bus passes were mailed on Tuesday, September 3rd. The students will be transported by a LEONIA BOARD OF EDUCATION bus.

Phishing Awareness
div.div: Phishing is a form of spam by which a user is baited with an email and tricked into “voluntarily” responding with information, downloading malware or performing an unauthorized transaction.
